entry.title: Carrbridge Packhorse Bridge (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Carrbridge Packhorse Bridge (pictured) is the oldest-known stone bridge in the Scottish Highlands?

entry.title: killing of Richard Ward (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that following the killing of Richard Ward by a Colorado sheriff's deputy, the deputy received an award for the injuries that he allegedly sustained during the incident?

entry.title: Arleigh Burke-class destroyers (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Arleigh Burke-class destroyers are hardened against electromagnetic pulses?

entry.title: Fraszki (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Jan Kochanowski's Fraszki is a 16th-century collection of almost 300 poems, ranging from anecdotes and epitaphs to obscenities and erotica?

entry.title: J.J. Wright (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that J.J. Wright fused Gregorian chant with jazz in his advent album O Emmanuel?

entry.title: lynching of Allen Brooks (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the site of the 1910 lynching of Allen Brooks was unmarked for 111 years?

entry.title: Mirtha Arce (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that out of 84 people running for governor seats in Bolivia in 2021, Mirtha Arce was one of just seven women and was the first in the Tarija Department to ever do so?

entry.title: Order of the Two Niles (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that while Egypt has the Order of the Nile, Sudan has the Order of the Two Niles, White and Blue?
